page.title: 17CROSSFORD:PROBLEMS OF GROWTH
page.content: The rapidly growing village of Crossford, with a present population of almost 3000, is very much a village of young families. Surveys have shown that only 16% of villagers are over 50 years old, while nearly 30% are below the age of 12. This rapid growth is due to the influx of young married couples into the village, some 77% of residents having moved to Crossford in the past ten years. This has led to a situation where facilities are insufficient to meet local demands, medical services in particular being picked out as those most required. A children's clinic is arranged weekly in the village hall, but there is no local doctor or pharmacist. The vast majority of people therefore travel out of the village for most of their needs.
